definition: to patrol/policeman (in China's former foreign concessions)
to patrol/to make one's rounds/classifier for rounds of drinks
(old) police station in a foreign concession 租界[zu1 jie4]

sentences.english: What he did in the old society is something like the policeman at modern times.
sentences.chinese: 在舊社會他做過巡捕，相當於現代的警察。

sentences.english: Alternate between playing as Frank Lucas, the gangster, and Richie Roberts, the cop.
sentences.chinese: 輪流充當弗蘭克盧卡斯，歹徒，和凱莉羅伯茨，巡捕。

sentences.english: The British imperialist police opened fire, killing and wounding many students.
sentences.chinese: 英帝國主義的巡捕向羣衆開槍，打死打傷許多人。

sentences.english: So handsome wave get notice on to save for hu and white.
sentences.chinese: 於是帥飄就趕快通知巡捕去救胡見長和白之際。

definition: (old) police station in a foreign concession 租界[zu1 jie4]
the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
bailiff responsible for catching criminals (in imperial China)
forced labor of feudal tenant (corvée)/bailiff of feudal yamen
to track down/to investigate and arrest

historical communal administrative and self-defence system created during the Song Dynasty and revived during the Republican Era, in which households are grouped in jia 甲[jia3] and jia are grouped in bao 保[bao3]
